qas.question: Where are Whitehead's works primarily studied in English-speaking countries?

answers.text: Claremont and a select number of liberal graduate-level theology and philosophy programs

qas.question: Where has interest outside of those areas mainly come from?

answers.text: through the work of his students and admirers rather

qas.question: Who are two of Whitehead's students that have gone on to become renowned in the field of analytic philosophy?

answers.text: Bertrand Russell, and he also taught and supervised the dissertation of Willard Van Orman Quine

qas.question: What did Gilles Deleuze say about Whitehead?

answers.text: "he stands provisionally as the last great Anglo-American philosopher before Wittgenstein's disciples spread their misty confusion, sufficiency, and terror."

qas.question: What French sociologist and anthropologist stated that Whitehead was "the greatest philosopher of the 20th century"?

plausible_answers.text: Claremont and a select number of liberal graduate-level theology and philosophy programs

qas.question: Where are Whitehead's works was not primarily studied in English-speaking countries?

plausible_answers.text: through the work of his students and admirers

qas.question: Where has no interest outside of those areas mainly come from?

plausible_answers.text: Bertrand Russell, and he also taught and supervised the dissertation of Willard Van Orman Quine

qas.question: Who are two of Whitehead's students that have not gone on to become renowned in the field of analytic philosophy?

plausible_answers.text: he stands provisionally as the last great Anglo-American philosopher before Wittgenstein's disciples spread their misty confusion, sufficiency, and terror

qas.question: What did Gilles Deleuze hate about Whitehead?

context: Overall, however, Whitehead's influence is very difficult to characterize. In English-speaking countries, his primary works are little-studied outside of <a0_0><b5_0>Claremont and a select number of liberal graduate-level theology and philosophy programs<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Outside of these circles his influence is relatively small and diffuse, and has tended to come chiefly <a1_0><b6_0>through the work of his students and admirers<b6_0/> rather<a1_0/> than Whitehead himself. For instance, Whitehead was a teacher and long-time friend and collaborator of <a2_0><b7_0>Bertrand Russell, and he also taught and supervised the dissertation of Willard Van Orman Quine<b7_0/><a2_0/>, both of whom are important figures in analytic philosophy – the dominant strain of philosophy in English-speaking countries in the 20th century. Whitehead has also had high-profile admirers in the continental tradition, such as French post-structuralist philosopher Gilles Deleuze, who once dryly remarked of Whitehead that <a3_0>"<b8_0>he stands provisionally as the last great Anglo-American philosopher before Wittgenstein's disciples spread their misty confusion, sufficiency, and terror<b8_0/>."<a3_0/> French sociologist and anthropologist <a4_0>Bruno Latour<a4_0/> even went so far as to call Whitehead "the greatest philosopher of the 20th century."
